definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)

sentences.english: China's open door policy has proved to be a huge success.
sentences.chinese: 中國的開革開放，得到了很大的成效。

sentences.english: The motive of the emotional movie is to move the removed men .
sentences.chinese: 那部感情電影的念頭在於激動被開革的人。
